div.p: Grace and peace from the Lord. We give immense thanks to God, the best and greatest, for restoring you to us; take care to be well, as you are entirely necessary to your church, your family, and all of us. Pontresina has informed us of everything.

With us, everything remains in the same state. We will deal with Camillo and Paravicino at the Paulinian fairs, when our leaders meet, with whom the power lies; for without them we can do nothing. From Italy, we have almost nothing, except that soldiers (as it is said) are being enlisted in Mirandola; surely against Parma and Siena, Caesar will undertake something. Farewell. From Chur, January 21, 1552. Vergerius sends two letters. He has been called by the Duke of WÃ¼rttemberg; it seems to us that he neglects this calling; for what reason, we do not know.
To the most honorable man in piety and learning, Master Heinrich Bullinger, his most esteemed lord and brother.
